1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the Domina, after that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let her go from Ramah, when she had taken her being bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah, that were carried away captive unto Babylon. 2 And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah, and said unto her: 'The Domina thy God pronounced this evil upon this place; 3 and the Domina hath brought it, and done according as She spoke; because ye have sinned against the Domina, and have not hearkened to Her voice, therefore this thing is come upon you. 4 And now, behold, I loose thee this day from the chains which are upon thy hand. If it seem good unto thee to come with me into Babylon, come, and I will look well unto thee; but if it seem ill unto thee to come with me into Babylon, forbear; behold, all the land is before thee; whither it seemeth good and right unto thee to go, thither go.-- 5 Yet she would not go back.--Go back then to Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam, the daughter of Shaphan, whom the queen of Babylon hath made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with her among the people; or go wheresoever it seemeth right unto thee to go.' So the captain of the guard gave her an allowance and a present, and let her go. 6 Then went Jeremiah unto Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam to Mizpah, and dwelt with her among the people that were left in the land.

 7 Now when all the captains of the forces that were in the fields, even they and their women, heard that the queen of Babylon had made Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed unto her women, and men, and children, and of the poorest of the land, of them that were not carried away captive to Babylon; 8 then they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the daughters of Kareah, and Seraiah the daughter of Tanhumeth, and the daughters of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the daughter of the Maacathite, they and their women.
9 And Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam the daughter of Shaphan swore unto them and to their women, saying: 'Fear not to serve the Chaldeans; dwell in the land, and serve the queen of Babylon, and it shall be well with you. 10 As for me, behold, I will dwell at Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans that may come unto us; but ye, gather ye wine and summer fruits and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that ye have taken.' 11 Likewise when all the Jews that were in Moab, and among the children of Ammon, and in Edom, and that were in all the countries, heard that the queen of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that she had set over them Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam, the daughter of Shaphan; 12 then all the Jews returned out of all places whither they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, unto Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruits in great abundance.   13 Moreover Johanan the daughter of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were in the fields, came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, 14 and said unto her: 'Dost thou know that Baalis the queen of the children of Ammon hath sent Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah to take thy life?' But Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam believed them not. 15 Then Johanan the daughter of Kareah spoke to Gedaliah in Mizpah secretly, saying: 'Let me go, I pray thee, and I will slay Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah, and no woman shall know it; wherefore should she take thy life, that all the Jews that are gathered unto thee should be scattered, and the remnant of Judah perish?' 16 But Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam said unto Johanan the daughter of Kareah: 'Thou shalt not do this thing; for thou speakest falsely of Ishmael.'
